children.text: The plaster bulkhead has been constructed out of parallel with the ceiling, indicating that either the ceiling, the bulkhead, or both are out of level.
The Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 9.17 Straightness and Alignment of Plaster Cornices, states that
‘Plaster cornices are defective if they deviate from a straight line greater than 4mm over a length of up to 2m’ .
The builder will need to confirm whether the ceiling or bulkhead is out of level, and reconstruct as necessary to ensure they are properly level and parallel.
